memberdef.name: CUDA_GUARD
memberdef.initializer: do { \ cudaError_t _st = (call); \ if (_st != cudaSuccess) { \ ie_cuda_set_err(cudaGetErrorString(_st)); \ return -(int)_st; \ } \ } while (0)

briefdescription.para: CUDA error guard macro that stores the error string and returns.

detaileddescription.para: Use this after launching kernels to convert CUDA errors into negative integer codes and a readable message retrievable via ie_cuda_last_error_string().

briefdescription.para: Set or clear the per-thread CUDA error string buffer.

parameterdescription.para: NULL to clear; otherwise a short literal/diagnostic string.

briefdescription.para: Apply a simple activation kind to a scalar.
Decode one E4M3 FP8 byte on device (subnormals flushed to zero).
Decode one E5M2 FP8 byte on device (IEEE-like special cases).

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const float *__restrict__ x, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, float alpha, float beta)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_rowwise_f32

briefdescription.para: Row-wise GEMV kernel: y = alpha * W * x + beta * y.

detaileddescription.para: Mapping: 1 block per row. Threads accumulate a strided reduction over K and reduce via shared memory. Assumes ldW >= cols.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const float *__restrict__ x, const float *__restrict__ bias, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, float alpha, float beta, ie_act_kind_t act)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_bias_act_f32

briefdescription.para: Fused GEMV + bias + activation kernel (float activations).

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const int8_t *__restrict__ xq, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, float scale, int zp, float alpha, float beta)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_rowwise_qi8_f32

briefdescription.para: Row-wise GEMV with INT8 activations (per-tensor), fused dequantization.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const uint8_t *__restrict__ x8, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, ie_fp8_format fmt, float alpha, float beta)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_rowwise_qfp8_f32

briefdescription.para: Row-wise GEMV with FP8 activations (E4M3/E5M2), fused decode.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *__restrict__ y, const float *__restrict__ x, int n)
memberdef.name: k_vec_tanh_f32

briefdescription.para: Elementwise hyperbolic tangent on a vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *__restrict__ Wp, const float *__restrict__ W, int rows, int cols, int ldW, int block_k)
memberdef.name: k_pack_w_blockedk_f32

briefdescription.para: Pack row-major W into Blocked-K layout on device.

detaileddescription.para: Layout: kb = k / block_k; // tile index along K ko = k % block_k; // in-tile offset dst = ((kb * rows + r) * block_k + ko) Wp[dst] = W[r * ldW + k]

briefdescription.para: CUDA implementations of GEMV/activation/packing kernels + C-ABI launchers.

detaileddescription.para: This is the only translation unit that includes CUDA headers. The public header ie_kernels_cuda.h keeps the rest of the codebase CUDA-agnostic.

sect2.title: Kernel policy (baseline, safe defaults)

listitem.para: GEMV row-wise: one block per output row, 256 threads per block, strided K loop with shared-memory reduction.
Fused GEMV+bias+activation: same grid policy with a short epilogue.
Vector tanh: grid-stride loop with 256-thread blocks, large grid.
Packing (Blocked-K): 2D grid over (cols, rows) with 32x8 threads.

sect2.para:
Additions in this file:
Fused INT8 activation GEMV (per-tensor parameters).
Fused FP8 activation GEMV (E4M3/E5M2) with on-device decoders.
These settings favor portability and predictability. They are easy to tune per architecture once you profile on target GPUs.
